ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.util

Class StepIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.util.StepIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGravisListIterator<String>, Iterable<String>, Iterator<String>

    public class StepIterator
extends Object
implements IGravisListIterator<String>
    This implementation of a bidirectinal immutable iterator iterates over a collection of step comments (String) and executes (or unexecutes) the steps. It decorates a given IGravisListIterator.
    Author:
    Patrick Kofmel (kofmp1@bfh.ch)

      • previous

        public String previous()
        Description copied from interface: IGravisListIterator
        Returns the previous element in the list and moves the cursor position backwards. This method may be called repeatedly to iterate through the list backwards, or intermixed with calls to Iterator.next() to go back and forth. (Note that alternating calls to next and previous will return the same element repeatedly.)
        Specified by:
        previous in interface IGravisListIterator<String>
        Returns:
        the previous element in the list

      • hasPrevious

        public boolean hasPrevious()
        Description copied from interface: IGravisListIterator
        Returns true if this list iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the reverse direction. (In other words, returns true if IGravisListIterator.previous() would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
        Specified by:
        hasPrevious in interface IGravisListIterator<String>
        Returns:
        true if the list iterator has more elements when traversing the list in the reverse direction
